page.title: 19Langley Wood,Sandridge
page.content: Langley Wood is typical of Hertfordshire woodland.There are coppiced hornbeams,whose wood was sent to London for fire wood and oak which was used for timber.The hornbeams were coppiced every 15 years.The oak trees were cut after 150 years.Langley Wood is ancient woodland because yellow archangel and bluebells grow there. Ancient woodland is wood that has not been disturbed since 1600.In May inside the wood it is like a river of bluebells.Maple trees, which are native to Britain, grow in the wood and also indicate its age. Lime trees, rare in woodland, are also found. There is a boundary bank which was built by a farmer to stop cattle getting into the wood.There are many spring flowering plants e.g.Dogs Mercury,pignut,wood anenome.
